name: Short-Cut PA Dutch Chicken Corn Soup
author: gdewey
summary: I had never had chicken corn soup until I moved to south central Pennsylvania. It is often found at local fairs and festivals and is now my favorite comfort food. This is a quick and easy version that shaves quite a bit of time and effort from the traditional method but tastes pretty close to the real thing.
ingredients: 1 (3 pound) whole rotisserie chicken - skinned, boned, and meat cut into bite-size pieces
1 (16 ounce) package frozen super-sweet white corn, thawed
1 teaspoon chicken soup base (paste), or more to taste
salt and ground black pepper to taste
directions: Pour chicken broth into a large soup pot and place over medium heat
Add chicken and any accumulated juices from the chicken to the broth
Stir corn, dry soup mix, and chicken soup base into broth mixture
Add noodles to soup and simmer until tender, about 10 minutes
Season with salt and black pepper
